snippet: It’s not just whether voters are better off than they were four years ago. They are. Voters should be asking how to ensure financial security.
abstract: Editorial argues that Democrats should have no fear when Republicans ask voters whether they are better off than they were in 2008; contends that America is unquestionably better off, having added 4.5 million private-sector jobs since January 2010, despite the disastrous economy and broken political landscape inherited by Pres Obama.
lead_paragraph: It’s not just whether voters are better off than they were four years ago. They are. Voters should be asking how to ensure financial security.

headline.seo: The Better Economic Question for Voters
